intro: Anethum ridolfia, commonly known as wild carrot or Queen Anne's lace, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant features slender, hollow stems and feathery, finely divided leaves. Its flowers are white with a single purple or red flower in the center, forming an umbrella-like shape. Anethum ridolfia is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some areas.
